title: 40% CDR Ezreal is now super awkward
body:
The changes to Qs CD mean that at max CDR, a consecutive Q will have a 1.2 sec CD. SpellBlade from IBG/TF has a 1.5 sec CD. I found this out the hard way using IBG and noticing that my 2nd Q offered no slow or bonus damage. I never thought I'd say this, but there is a thing as too much CDR on Ezreal. It seems anything over 33% (4.5-4.5*.33-1.5 = 1.515) suffers from this issue. 

This is yet another situation where ER is shown to have poor synergy with Ezreal. For one, his Q doesn't crit. so neither the mana return nor the crit. are as useful as one would expect. Of course, you still auto but not quite as much as other ADCs. ER is much more synergistic with nearly every other caster ADC (think Lucian, Corki, Graves). Now, because Ezreal gets a Sheen item to make his poke more potent, he already has 10% CDR and ER caps it to 40% after IE, creating the issue described. You could suggest not to get IE on Ezreal but that makes the whole build seem rather pointless. Why build 40% crit. chance and then fail to get the biggest crit. damage increase item in the game?

Ezreal has needed some buffs or tweaks for a while but I now dislike the latest Q changes and would much rather they buff his W to include an AD scaling or something of the sort. Alternatively, his Q could have a longer CD but some sort of crit. modifier etc. I'm just brainstorming but I shouldn't have to worry about building too much CDR on a champion that seems so suited to it. It's strange enough for me, but just imagine for someone newer. They'll probably think IBG is bugged. Riot needs to really figure out what Ezreal is supposed to do best and how to get him to that state smoothly. I don't want something terrible and lackluster pigeonholed into essentially one build and playstyle like what happened to Kog'Maw.

He seems like he should be more of a caster marksman, who goes for a mid-game spike instead of hyper-scaling with crit, like Corki. The problem is that his early is weak, and since he kind of needs to build Tear so he won't go oom (another reason the crit build above is awkward), so it takes him too long to reach his midgame spike.

What if they redesigned his Q to receive some form of scaling % dmg on crit (IE: with 50% crit it does an extra 10% damage or some such, numbers can be balanced/scaled accordingly) this gives him a reason to weave when he can (more damage from auto crits) but also lets his Q have something similar to a crit without being overbearing as a crit.

Then they can change up the % and it wouldn't effect AP EZ unless they buy crit (which would be wierd, but i could see some obscene ap/crit split build chunking with Q somehow) but it'd be better than it is.

The thing I find odd is that he has this magic gauntlet but everything is just "fire a straight projectile", I think they should change his abilities up.

I like it. Right now there's this duality within his Q where it's kind of like an auto because it applies on-hit effects like an auto (which is why all Sheen items are good on him, obviously), but it can't crit like an auto. Yet, it would be understandably weird for an ability such as his Q to crit fully. Having a modification crit % of some sort would be a great way to balance this friction out.

Riot has certainly found other unorthodox methods to balance champs, after all. Just looking at marksmen alone, Kalista has that "autos only do 90% AD" thing and Caitlyn has...well...just look at her passive as written on the wiki.

> Caitlyn's next basic attack against enemies rooted by Yordle Snap Trap or slowed by 90 Caliber Net gains an additional 650 range and deals 50% + (critical chance × 1 + (0.5 × bonus critical damage))% AD bonus physical damage, modified to 150% AD versus minions and monsters.
Additionally, Caitlyn permanently has 10% bonus attack speed and her unenhanced basic attacks each generate a stack of Headshot, doubled when attacking from brush, granting her next basic attack the same bonus damage at 6 stacks, though this does not benefit from bonus range, nor is it consumed on other instances of Headshot.

Goodness. A crit modifier on Ez's Q seems pretty damn simple in comparison, huh.

Anybody have any reasons why OP's idea might be a bad idea? And if so, how could Riot avoid this problem?

If you mean "pls rework Void Staff the way you reworked Last Whisper so it's an actual anti-tank item instead of a 'murder everyone' item", then I agree.  It could build into a tweaked Liandry's that is more focused on melting tanks and a redesigned Morellonomicon where the GW was an actual reason you went for it instead of "ball of stats that randomly has GW".

Although that raises the question of whether there should be good flat magic pen items as an alternative to the VS items, for people who just want to blow up squishies with magic burst damage, or whether they should just build more straight AP and "extra ratio" items like Luden's or Lichbane.  Maybe Haunting Guise should get a different upgrade (since a *flat* magic pen item building into an anti-tank item doesn't really work in the first place).

It kind of looks like fixing VS's "too good at everything" problem would require an AP item redesign as big as, or even bigger than, last season's, just to give flat pen and %pen more different strengths and uses.  Too bad they didn't tackle it then.

No, i did not mean this. What i said was pretty straightforward. Bring the old last whisper back. The thing is they reworked last whisper because of the ADC rework but that hurt assassins as well. Sorry but, with all those base stats late game and no % total armor pen you can't do your job as an AD assassin as effectively. What is your job? Blow up squishies and do over all good damage even to beefy but not kill blow them up. Thing is, now, late game, you can't blow up even a squishy with no % total armor pen. Ok, you have black cleaver but it's not good enough, cleaver needs stacking and that counter productive for an assassin who needs immediate access to his burst. Black cleaver is a bruiser item, not an assassin item. At least give an item that has the same % pen that the cleaver has in shred which is 30%. With the flat pen from current items, masteries and with 30% total pen, you are effective enough to blow up squishies and at the same time, you do not have enough % total pen to burst down tanks. They could do that with the new assassin item and make it melee only so that ADCs can't buy it. Seriously, it's far better for assassin in late game. Also, there is a distinct difference between armor and mr. Most champions have 30 flat mr that does not scale with level and others scale from 30 to 54 at level 18. So, with sorc boots, mpen in runes and masteries and void staff, you do true damage to everyone who didn't get an mr item while with armor, all champions scale from about 20 to 94 at lvl 18 with most common bas armor being around 80 and if you add runes to that you easily get a figure around 100. this is a lot more than 30 or 54 isn't it? So, with just this low flat armor pen and no % armor pen, how are you gonna assassinate??? You won't if your target knows what to do and if a support is always around. They must make an item with % total armor pen for assassins only. Black cleaver is not for assassins, it's for bruisers and tanks.

The difference is that ADCs do sustained damage while most mages are burst oriented. If you rework VS the same way, you can negate their entire kit with a bit of MR. Mages would simply not have the necessary influence to feel satisfying mid-late game and tanks would be unbearable.

I LOVE the new patch
